page.title: 07PIG FARM _ WOODSIDE(PART II)
page.content: The pigs which are kept here are a cross betwen a{Large White}boar and a hybrid female.They are specially bred for top quality meat production. Mr.Sinclair,who is in the manager of Cavray's(the trade name of Cavaghan and Gray's) pig farms,said that the biggest problem with intensive pig farming was disease and that his bills for the vet's services were "astronomical".Common diseases were; pneumonia,foot and mouth,aujesky's disease,scour and Smedi virus.Smedi virus causes the sows to lose their litter.Mr.Sinclair said that they try to prevent disease by providing very good ventilation,innoculation,strict hygiene and giving visitors protect_ ive footwear and clothing. On average Cavray's expect to get 360 rashers of bacon from each pig as well as gammon,fore and leg joints.
